Discription: A drug reaction is an adverse response to medication, ranging from mild rashes to severe anaphylaxis. It can occur immediately or after prolonged use.
Mild Treatment: Discontinuation of the offending drug and supportive care.
Intense Treatment: Emergency treatment if severe (e.g., anaphylaxis), such as epinephrine and hospitalization.
Precaution: Avoidance of known allergens, alerting healthcare providers of drug allergies.
Exercise: Light activity, 20 minutes, daily; gentle stretching, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by Plasmodium parasites transmitted through the bites of infected Anopheles mosquitoes. Symptoms include fever, chills, and flu-like illness.
Intense Treatment: Intravenous antimalarials, supportive care.
Precaution: Use insect repellent, sleep under mosquito nets.
Exercise: Rest during recovery; Light walking, 10 minutes, daily after recovery.

Discription: Allergies are immune responses to specific substances (allergens) causing symptoms such as sneezing, itching, and hives. They can be triggered by food, pollen, dust, or other irritants.
Mild Treatment: Antihistamines, avoidance of known allergens, and use of allergy-proof bedding.
Intense Treatment: Immunotherapy (allergy shots) for severe cases, and avoidance of triggers.
Precaution: Regular use of prescribed medications, and keeping living areas clean.
Exercise: Moderate aerobic exercise, 20 minutes, daily; gentle stretching, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormones, leading to fatigue, weight gain, and depression.
Intense Treatment: Same as mild, requires long-term management.
Precaution: Regular thyroid function tests, consistent medication intake.
Exercise: Yoga, 30 minutes daily.

Precaution_1: wash hands with warm soapy water
Discription: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell turnover, leading to red, scaly patches on the skin.
Intense Treatment: Phototherapy, systemic medications.
Precaution: Moisturize regularly, avoid skin injuries.
Exercise: Swimming, 30 minutes daily.

Discription: GERD is a chronic digestive condition where stomach acid frequently leaks into the esophagus, causing heartburn, regurgitation, and discomfort.
Mild Treatment: Antacids, proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), and dietary modifications.
Intense Treatment: Prescription-strength medications or surgery if lifestyle changes and medications are ineffective.
Precaution: Avoid trigger foods, eat smaller meals, and avoid lying down after eating.
Exercise: Light aerobic exercise, 20 minutes, daily; gentle stretching, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Chronic cholestasis is a liver condition where bile flow is impaired, leading to the accumulation of bile acids in the liver. Symptoms include jaundice and itching.
Mild Treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, such as ursodeoxycholic acid.
Intense Treatment: Treatment of underlying causes, such as liver disease, and possibly liver transplantation in severe cases.
Precaution: Regular liver function monitoring, dietary adjustments to support liver health.
Exercise: Gentle aerobic exercise, 20 minutes, daily; light stretching, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Hepatitis A is a viral liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus (HAV). It is usually spread through ingestion of contaminated food or water and leads to symptoms such as fatigue, nausea, abdominal pain, and jaundice.
Intense Treatment: Supportive care, hospitalization for severe cases.
Precaution: Vaccination, maintain good hygiene.
Exercise: Gentle walking, 20 minutes, daily; Light stretching, 10 minutes, daily.

Discription: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease where the cartilage that cushions the ends of the bones wears down, causing pain and stiffness.
Intense Treatment: Joint injections, joint replacement surgery.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy weight, avoid joint overuse.
Exercise: Low-impact aerobic exercise, 30 minutes daily.

Discription: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV) is a disorder arising from a problem in the inner ear, causing brief episodes of dizziness with changes in head position.
Intense Treatment: Medication (e.g., meclizine), surgery in rare cases.
Precaution: Avoid sudden head movements, use support when dizzy.
Exercise: Balance exercises, 15 minutes daily.

Discription: Hypoglycemia occurs when blood sugar levels drop too low, leading to symptoms such as shakiness, confusion, and fainting. It often affects people with diabetes.
Mild Treatment: Consume fast-acting carbohydrates (e.g., glucose tablets, fruit juice).
Intense Treatment: Glucagon injection, hospitalization if severe.
Precaution: Regular blood sugar monitoring, carry glucose tablets.
Exercise: Moderate exercise (walking), 30 minutes daily.

Discription: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, leading to pimples, blackheads, and cysts.
Intense Treatment: Oral antibiotics, isotretinoin.
Precaution: Avoid heavy makeup, keep skin clean.
Exercise: Not specific for acne, general fitness recommended.

Discription: Diabetes is a metabolic disease that causes high blood sugar. The hormone insulin moves sugar from the blood into your cells to be stored or used for energy. With diabetes, your body either doesn't make enough insulin or can't effectively use the insulin it does make.
Intense Treatment: Insulin therapy, regular monitoring.
Precaution: Regular blood sugar monitoring, maintain a balanced diet.
Exercise: Brisk walking, 30 minutes, daily; Cycling, 30 minutes, 3 times a week.

Precaution_1: soak affected area in warm water
Precaution_3: remove scabs with wet compressed cloth
Discription: Impetigo is a highly contagious bacterial skin infection, most common in young children. It causes red sores that can rupture, ooze, and form a yellow-brown crust.
Intense Treatment: Oral antibiotics for widespread infection.
Precaution: Maintain good hygiene, avoid close contact with infected individuals.
Exercise: Not specific for impetigo, general fitness recommended

Discription: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high, often leading to heart disease and stroke. It can be managed through lifestyle changes and medication.
Intense Treatment: Combination drug therapy, regular monitoring.
Precaution: Low-sodium diet, regular blood pressure checks.
Exercise: Brisk walking, 30 minutes, daily; Yoga, 20 minutes, 3 times a week.

Discription: Peptic ulcer disease involves sores on the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus, caused by H. pylori infection or NSAID use, leading to abdominal pain and indigestion
Mild Treatment: Acid reducers (PPIs or H2 blockers), antibiotics for H. pylori infection.
Intense Treatment: Surgery in severe cases with complications such as bleeding or perforation.
Precaution: Avoid NSAIDs, limit alcohol and caffeine, follow prescribed medication regimen.
Exercise: Light abdominal exercises, 15 minutes, daily; low-impact walking, 30 minutes, daily.

Discription: Hemorrhoids are swollen veins in the lower rectum and anus, which can cause discomfort, bleeding, and itching. They are classified as internal or external.
Intense Treatment: Rubber band ligation, surgical removal.
Precaution: Avoid straining during bowel movements, stay hydrated.
Exercise: Kegel exercises, 10 minutes twice daily.

Discription: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, usually caused by rhinoviruses. Symptoms include a runny nose, sore throat, cough, and sneezing.
Intense Treatment: Not applicable, supportive care.
Precaution: Good hygiene, avoid close contact with infected individuals.
Exercise: Light stretching, 10 minutes daily.

Discription: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin. It is caused by the varicella-zoster virus and is most common in children.
Intense Treatment: Antiviral medications, hospitalization if complications arise.
Precaution: Avoid scratching, stay isolated to prevent spreading
Exercise: Rest during acute phase; Gentle stretching, 10 minutes, daily during recovery.

Precaution_1: use heating pad or cold pack
Discription: Cervical spondylosis is a degenerative condition of the cervical spine, often caused by aging and wear and tear on the bones and cartilage in the neck. Symptoms include neck pain and stiffness, headaches, and sometimes neurological symptoms.
Intense Treatment: Cervical collar, surgery in severe cases.
Precaution: Good posture, ergonomic adjustments
Exercise: Neck stretches, 10 minutes, daily; Gentle yoga, 20 minutes, 3 times a week

Discription: Hyperthyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone, causing weight loss, rapid heartbeat, and anxiety.
Intense Treatment: Radioactive iodine therapy, thyroidectomy.
Precaution: Regular monitoring, avoid excessive iodine intake.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes daily.

Discription: A urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, most commonly the bladder and urethra. Symptoms include a strong, persistent urge to urinate, burning sensation when urinating.
Intense Treatment: Hospitalization for severe cases, intravenous antibiotics.
Precaution: Urinate frequently, wipe from front to back.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes daily.

Precaution_1: lie down flat and raise the leg high
Discription: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins often appearing in the legs, caused by faulty valves that allow blood to pool. Symptoms include aching, swelling, and visible veins.
Intense Treatment: Sclerotherapy, vein stripping.
Precaution: Avoid prolonged standing, maintain a healthy weight.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes daily.

Discription: AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome) is a chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). HIV damages the immune system, interfering with the body's ability to fight infections and diseases. It is primarily spread through unprotected sex, contaminated needles, and from mother to child during birth or breastfeeding.
Intense Treatment: Advanced ART regimens, treatment of opportunistic infections.
Precaution: Safe sex practices, avoid sharing needles.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes, daily; Strength training, 20 minutes, 3 times a week.

Discription: Paralysis due to brain hemorrhage occurs when there is bleeding in or around the brain, leading to loss of muscle function in part of the body. This can result from stroke, trauma, or aneurysm.
Mild Treatment: Physical rehabilitation, medications to manage symptoms.
Intense Treatment: Surgery to relieve pressure, intensive rehabilitation.
Precaution: Control blood pressure, avoid head injuries.
Exercise: Passive range-of-motion exercises, 20 minutes, daily; Assisted walking, as tolerated.

Discription: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, spread through contaminated food and water. Symptoms include prolonged fever, abdominal pain, and a rash.
Intense Treatment: IV antibiotics, hospitalization for severe cases.
Precaution: Drink clean water, maintain good hygiene.
Exercise: Rest during acute phase; Gentle walking, 15 minutes, daily during recovery.

Discription: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease. It is transmitted through contact with infectious body fluids, such as blood, semen, and vaginal fluids.
Intense Treatment: Liver transplantation in severe cases, advanced antiviral therapy.
Precaution: Vaccination, avoid sharing needles.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes, daily; Strength training, 20 minutes, 3 times a week.

Precaution_2: use detol or neem in bathing water
Discription: Fungal infections occur when fungi invade and grow on the skin, nails, or mucous membranes. Symptoms vary depending on the type of fungus and location but often include itching and rash.
Intense Treatment: Oral antifungal medications for widespread or resistant infections.
Precaution: Keep affected areas dry, avoid sharing personal items, and follow treatment instructions.
Exercise: Low-impact exercises, 20 minutes, daily; gentle stretching, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage. It is primarily spread through blood-to-blood contact.
Intense Treatment: Direct-acting antivirals, liver transplantation in severe cases.
Precaution: Avoid sharing needles, practice safe sex.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes, daily; Yoga, 20 minutes, 3 times a week.

Discription: Migraine is a neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound. Migraine attacks can last for hours to days.
Mild Treatment: NSAIDs, rest in a dark room.
Intense Treatment: Triptans, preventive medications.
Precaution: Avoid known triggers, maintain a regular sleep schedule.
Exercise: Gentle yoga, 20 minutes, daily; Walking, 30 minutes, daily.

Discription: Bronchial asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease of the airways characterized by variable and recurring symptoms, airflow obstruction, and bronchospasm. Symptoms include wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath.
Intense Treatment: Long-term inhaled corticosteroids, oral steroids during severe attacks.
Precaution: Avoid allergens, regular medication.
Exercise: Breathing exercises, 15 minutes, daily; Swimming, 30 minutes, 3 times a week.

Discription: Alcoholic hepatitis is liver inflammation caused by excessive alcohol consumption. It can lead to liver scarring (cirrhosis) and liver failure. Symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, and nausea.
Mild Treatment: Abstain from alcohol, take prescribed vitamins (e.g., thiamine).
Intense Treatment: Corticosteroids, liver transplant.
Precaution: Avoid alcohol, regular monitoring by a healthcare provider.
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes daily.

Precaution_3: eat fruits and high fiberous food
Discription: Jaundice is a condition characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels. It is often a sign of an underlying issue such as liver disease, hemolysis, or bile duct obstruction.
Intense Treatment: Treatment of underlying cause, phototherapy in newborns.
Precaution: Avoid alcohol, maintain a healthy diet.
Exercise: Gentle walking, 20 minutes, daily; Light stretching, 10 minutes, daily.

Discription: Hepatitis E is a liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus (HEV). It is typically spread through contaminated drinking water and causes symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
Intense Treatment: Supportive care, hospitalization for severe cases.
Precaution: Drink clean water, maintain good hygiene.
Exercise: Gentle walking

Discription: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms, including severe headache, joint and muscle pain, rash, and bleeding tendencies. It can progress to severe dengue, which is potentially fatal.
Intense Treatment: Hospitalization, IV fluids, blood transfusions.
Precaution: Avoid mosquito bites, use insect repellent.
Exercise: Rest during acute phase; Light walking, 10 minutes, daily during recovery.

Discription: Hepatitis D is a serious liver disease caused by the hepatitis D virus (HDV), which relies on hepatitis B virus for its replication. It is transmitted through contact with infected blood or body fluids.
Intense Treatment: Interferon therapy, liver transplantation in severe cases.
Precaution: Vaccination for hepatitis B, avoid sharing needles.
Exercise: Gentle walking, 20 minutes, daily; Light stretching, 10 minutes, daily.

Discription: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked for a long enough time that part of the heart muscle is damaged or dies. Symptoms include chest pain, shortness of breath, and nausea.
Intense Treatment: Angioplasty, coronary artery bypass surgery.
Precaution: Regular cardiovascular check-ups, healthy diet
Exercise: Walking, 30 minutes daily.

Discription: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid. It can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi. Symptoms include cough, fever, and difficulty breathing.
Mild Treatment: Antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, rest, fluids.
Intense Treatment: Hospitalization, intravenous antibiotics, oxygen therapy.
Precaution: Vaccination, avoid smoking.
Exercise: Deep breathing exercises, 15 minutes twice daily.

Discription: Arthritis is inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness that can worsen with age. There are many types, including rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.
Intense Treatment: Disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), biologics.
Precaution: Regular exercise, avoid joint strain.
Exercise: Swimming, 30 minutes daily.

Precaution_1: stop eating solid food for while
Precaution_2: try taking small sips of water
Discription: Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically resulting from a viral or bacterial infection. Symptoms include diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and fever.
Intense Treatment: IV fluids, antibiotics if bacterial.
Precaution: Avoid contaminated food and water, practice good hygiene.
Exercise: Light stretching, 10 minutes, daily; Walking, 15 minutes, daily.

Discription: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs but can spread to other organs. Symptoms include persistent cough, weight loss, and night sweats.
Mild Treatment: First-line anti-TB drugs (e.g., isoniazid, rifampicin) for six months.
Intense Treatment: Extended or second-line drug therapy, possibly surgery.
Precaution: Isolation during contagious period, regular follow-ups.
Exercise: Breathing exercises, 15 minutes twice daily.
